data.content: Diseña un chatbot para una central de reservas hoteleras que atienda 24/7, aunque el soporte humano solo esté disponible de 9 a 21 h. El bot debe responder preguntas frecuentes, consultar disponibilidad y gestionar reservas. Para reservar, pedirá fecha de entrada/salida y tipo de habitación (estándar $80, doble $120, suite $200). Se permiten hasta 3 habitaciones por tipo. Calculará el total automáticamente. El flujo debe ser flexible y natural, sin forzar al usuario a reservar si solo tiene dudas. La experiencia debe ser sencilla y completa.

Based on your request for a hotel reservation chatbot that operates 24/7, answers frequently asked questions, checks availability, and manages reservations, I have created the necessary Taskyto YAML content. This includes modules for the main menu, question answering, data gathering for reservations, and actions to calculate totals. Below are the YAML fragments for your Taskyto project.

```yaml
# -----> File: top_level.yaml <-----
modules:
- name: top-level
  kind: menu
  presentation: |
    Welcome to our hotel reservation chatbot! I'm here to assist you 24/7 with any inquiries, check availability, and help you make reservations.
  fallback: I'm sorry, I didn't understand that. Could you please rephrase?

  items:
  - title: Frequently Asked Questions
    kind: module
    reference: faq_module
  - title: Check Availability
    kind: module
    reference: check_availability
  - title: Make a Reservation
    memory: full
    kind: module
    reference: make_reservation
  - title: Welcome Message
    kind: answer
    answer: |
      Hello! I'm your assistant for hotel reservations. How can I help you today?
```

```yaml
# -----> File: faq_module.yaml <-----
name: faq_module
kind: question_answering
description: This module answers frequently asked questions about the hotel.
questions:
- question: What are the hotel check-in and check-out times?
  answer: Check-in is at 3 PM and check-out is at 11 AM.
- question: What types of rooms do you offer?
  answer: We offer standard ($80), double ($120), and suite ($200) rooms.
- question: Is breakfast included in the room price?
  answer: Yes, breakfast is included for all guests.
- question: What is your cancellation policy?
  answer: You can cancel your reservation up to 24 hours before check-in without any charge.
- question: Do you have parking available?
  answer: Yes, we offer free parking for all our guests.
```

```yaml
# -----> File: check_availability.yaml <-----
name: check_availability
kind: data_gathering
description: |
  Please provide your check-in and check-out dates to check room availability.
data:
  - check_in_date: date
  - check_out_date: date
  - room_type:
      type: enum
      values:
        - standard
        - double
        - suite
  - number_of_rooms:
      type: integer

on-success:
  response:
    text: "Checking availability for {number_of_rooms} {room_type} room(s) from {check_in_date} to {check_out_date}."
    rephrase: simple
```

```yaml
# -----> File: make_reservation.yaml <-----
name: make_reservation
kind: data_gathering
description: |
  To make a reservation, please provide your check-in and check-out dates, room type, and number of rooms.
data:
  - check_in_date: date
  - check_out_date: date
  - room_type:
      type: enum
      values:
        - standard
        - double
        - suite
  - number_of_rooms:
      type: integer

on-success:
  execute:
    language: python
    code: |
      def main(check_in_date, check_out_date, room_type, number_of_rooms):
          prices = {'standard': 80, 'double': 120, 'suite': 200}
          total = prices[room_type] * number_of_rooms
          return f"Your reservation for {number_of_rooms} {room_type} room(s) from {check_in_date} to {check_out_date} has been confirmed. Total cost: ${total}."

  response:
    text: "{result}"
    rephrase: simple
```

This YAML content provides a comprehensive structure for your hotel reservation chatbot, ensuring it can handle inquiries, check availability, and manage reservations effectively. You can copy and paste these fragments into your Taskyto project. If you need further modifications or additional features, feel free to ask!
